title: Individual Student Behavior Assessment Survey
subtitle: For Teachers & Support Staff | Ugly Duck School – Kunming, China

intro.purpose: This survey is designed to gather detailed insights about an individual student's academic growth, social-emotional development, and support needs from educators, learning specialists, and program staff.
intro.bullet1: Identify student strengths and growth areas
intro.bullet3: Ensure every student receives the right tools to thrive
intro.confidential: All responses are confidential and used only to improve student support and learning strategies.

consent.text: I understand and consent to provide feedback about the student named in this survey. I understand my responses will remain confidential and will be used to enhance educational planning and support.

section1.title: Assessor Information

assessorRole.label: Your Role at the Learning Center

frequency.label: How often do you work directly with this student?

section1.aiUsageNote: These two questions will only appear once when you start your batch of student assessments.

aiFrequency.label: How often do you use AI tools (e.g., Deep Seek, ChatGPT) in your teaching?

aiTasks.label: Which tasks do you use AI for? (Select all that apply)

livingSituation.label: Student's Primary Living Situation (Select all that apply)

educationHistory.label: Educational History (prior to Ugly Duck School) (Select all that apply)
educationHistory.special: Special education program or resource center
educationHistory.disrupted: Periods of disrupted education or Irregular attendance

supportFlags.label: Known Identity, Neurodiversity, or Support Flags (Select all that apply)

supportNetwork.label: Support Network Accessibility (Home or External) (Select all that apply)
supportNetwork.counseling: Regular access to counseling or therapy

homeResources.label: Student's Access to Learning Resources at Home (Select all that apply)
homeResources.minimal: Minimal or no access to resources

emotionalSupport.label: Emotional & Social Support Systems Available (Select all that apply)

pastStress.label: Has the student ever expressed or demonstrated stress related to past school experiences?
pastStress.occasionally: Occasionally avoids learning due to past trauma

trustedAdult.label: Does the student have a trusted adult or mentor within the school?
trustedAdult.benefit: Student may benefit from being matched with one

identityStress.label: Does the student express or show signs of cultural, racial, or identity-based stress or exclusion? (e.g., language challenges, religious differences, gender identity discomfort)

overallProgress.label: How would you rate the student's overall academic progress?
overallProgress.progressing: Progressing with support (Slightly below expected level)

supportAreas.label: Areas Requiring Additional Support (Check all that apply)

learningStyle.label: Observed Learning Style or Preferences (Check all that apply)

taskApproach.label: Observed task approach (Select all that apply)
taskApproach.avoids: Often avoids or disengages from tasks

executiveFunction.label: Executive Function Skills – Observed Challenges (Check all that apply)

gaps.label: Has the student experienced any significant gaps or interruptions in schooling (e.g., COVID, relocation, trauma, illness)?

extendedTasks.label: How does the student respond to extended or multi-step academic tasks?
extendedTasks.breaks: Breaks it down and manages independently
extendedTasks.overwhelmed: Gets overwhelmed or avoids the task

metacognitive.label: Does the student demonstrate metacognitive awareness (ability to reflect on how they learn)?
metacognitive.yes: Yes – verbalizes their process and needs
metacognitive.sometimes: Sometimes notices and asks for help

enrollmentReasons.label: What are the main reasons the student is enrolled in this program? (Select all that apply)
enrollmentReasons.handson: Preference for hands-on or creative methods
enrollmentReasons.safer: Need for a safer or more supportive setting

goals.label: Student's Self-Identified or Observed Goals (Select all that apply)

passion.label: Has the student shared or demonstrated a long-term passion or personal project?

futureReaction.label: How does the student react to conversations about their future (e.g., goals, careers, life after school)?
futureReaction.anxious: Anxious or overwhelmed by future plans

selfDoubt.label: Does the student express self-doubt or fear of failure around learning or future planning?

barriers.label: Barriers to Goal Progression (Check all that apply)

interaction.label: How does the student interact with others?

feedback.label: Response to feedback or challenges:
feedback.accepts: Accepts feedback and grows from it
feedback.resistant: Resistant at first, but improves over time
feedback.frustrated: Becomes frustrated or defensive to correction
feedback.avoids: Avoids challenges or gives up easily

emotionalRegulation.label: Emotional Regulation Skills (Select all that apply)
emotionalRegulation.most: Manages most stress with support: Sometimes overwhelmed by frustration
emotionalRegulation.often: Often shows emotional distress: Frequently overwhelmed or reactive
emotionalRegulation.difficulty: Has difficulty calming down without help: Needs significant emotional support

behavioral.label: Behavioral observations (Select all that apply)
behavioral.cooperative: Cooperative and engaged: Follows rules and routines consistently

selfRegulate.label: What strategies does the student use to calm themselves or self-regulate? (Select all that apply)
selfRegulate.leaving: Leaving the room or taking a walk

triggers.label: What triggers emotional dysregulation for this student? (Select all that apply)

empathy.label: Does the student show empathy or emotional awareness of others?
empathy.yes: Yes – often checks in with peers

currentSupport.label: What support is the student currently receiving? (Select all that apply)

effectiveMethods.label: What teaching methods work well for this student? (Select all that apply)
effectiveMethods.clear: Clear structure, routines and consistent expectations

additionalSupport.label: Additional support that may benefit the student (Select all that apply)
additionalSupport.counseling: Counseling, mental health support or trauma-informed care

goals.label: Recommended goals or milestones for this student (Academic or Behavioral)

timeOfDay.label: What time of day does the student typically engage most effectively?
timeOfDay.varies: Varies depending on subject or support

visualAids.label: How does the student respond to visual aids, routines, or planning tools?
visualAids.notYet: Not yet introduced to these supports

familyResponsive.label: Is the family/caregiver responsive to school communication and support planning?

environmentalChanges.label: Are there systemic or environmental changes that would help this student thrive (e.g., sensory room, schedule adjustment, mentor match)?

studentAiUsage.label: How often does this student use AI tools for homework or in class?

studentAiActivities.label: Which activities does the student use AI for? (Select all that apply)

futureAiSupport.label: How might AI best support this student's learning or well-being going forward?

observations.label: Any other observations or context to consider for this student's development?

suggestions.label: Suggestions for how the school team can better support this student's success:

thankYou.title: Thank you for sharing!
thankYou.message: Your responses will help us create a learning experience that celebrates students' strengths and supports their needs.
